meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a chorus.
meanings.sent1: The choric voices of the singers blended beautifully in harmony.
meanings.sent2: The choric performance at the concert captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The choric choir members wore matching outfits, making them look like a team.
meanings.sent4: The choric unity of the group was like a symphony of cooperation.
meanings.sent5: The choric melodies echoed through the hall, leaving a lasting impression.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a chorion.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the choric changes happening in the chorion during pregnancy.
meanings.sent2: The choric structure of the chorion provides essential support to the developing embryo.
meanings.sent3: The choric chorion cells were examined closely under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The choric protection of the chorion shielded the fetus from harm.
meanings.sent5: The choric growth of the chorion indicated a healthy pregnancy.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a chorale.
meanings.sent1: The choric hymns sung by the congregation filled the church with joy.
meanings.sent2: The choric tradition of singing chorales has been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent3: The choric chorale practice was filled with laughter and camaraderie.
meanings.sent4: The choric spirit of the chorale lifted the spirits of all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The choric harmonies of the chorale resonated deeply with the audience.
